intro: Plagiobasis dshungaricus, commonly known as the Mongolian grasshopper plant, is a perennial herb native to the steppes of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family, and is characterized by its slender, grass-like appearance. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters and has narrow, linear leaves. It produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Due to its adaptation to arid and semi-arid environments, it plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing forage for local wildlife.
